file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 71-12-02-06 - HOLD-OPEN ROD - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL HOLD-OPEN ROD - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the inspection of the engine cowling hold-open rod for permitted damage. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ENGINE COWLING HOLD-OPEN ROD - ALL 71-12-02-200-801-A INSPECTION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 71-12-02 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 71-12-02-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. ENGINE COWLING HOLD-OPEN ROD - INSPECTION A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to inspect the engine cowling hold-open rod for permitted damage. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 413 Lower cowling LH Engine 423 Lower cowling RH Engine D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Workstand To get access to the cowling 1 F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the engine I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the START 1/2 circuit breakers and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it: (2) Put the workstand in the work area. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 71-12-02 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Inspect Engine Cowling Hold-Open Rod (Figure 601) SUBTASK 220-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO THE MATERIAL. (1) Do an inspection on the engine cowling hold-open rod for chafing. If chafing occurs, and it is not deeper than 0.5 mm, smooth the affected area with sand paper Gr. 400 or greater to get L(Length)/H(Height) = 20 and protect the reworked area with Alodine and epoxy primer. Refer to Corrosion Prevention Manual chapter 51. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag and close the START 1/2 circuit breakers. (2) Remove the workstand from the work area. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 71-12-02 Page 3 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
